column4: First I install Ubuntu then Mint, the Menu goes to control by Mint at first, then somehow I update Ubuntu with about 100MB stuff, then I reboot, then I found Ubuntu took over the boot Menu again, which was FINE to me (I don't know who takes the control of boot Menu, if they can work, I can choose between them, who control it doesn't matter much to me) but when Windows 7 came alone, then everything is gone, There will be ONLY windows 7 o
n system when booting up, NO MENU, no nothing.
so, I follow the instructions from Ubuntu  Documentation
followed
and I made it!!
so.... the problem now, is how do I add windows 7 onto my boot up Menu?
Is there anything I should know before I read the link?
Yup! jongbergs, after installing win7, the grub menu had gone, nothing appears, booting up turned out goes into Windows 7 directly, no menu, so Windows 7 is MENU KILLER
but I saved it by many commands which is Ubuntu Documentation told me to. It was really big help
reinstall grub, but I think grub is doing all right.... because windows 7 was the last OS I installed, maybe that's why grub didn't notice it?
yeah, always install windows first, THEN linux
yes, I know, but I am sure you guys can EDIT the menu, right?
let me give you a hint I wish someone would've given me a LOOOONG time about about linux
there are usually 2 ways of doing things in linux: the easy way, and the time-consuming, pain-in-the-back way
which one do you want?
noone here is going to step you through it, though
it was ALREADY given to you
give it to me again plz
it's what EVERYONE has been posting you on
see all those messages from ubottu?
yes
at this point, I am going to assume you like yanking people's chains
